data.title: Timmins Daily Press
data.meta_description: Claire Bolduc passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Timmins Daily Press on 2023-10-18.
data.text:
It is with great sorrow that the family announces the death of Claire Bolduc (née Lévesque) on Monday October 16, 2023 at the age of 84. She was predeceased by her husband Ludger Bolduc in 2010.

Cherished mother of Ginette Bélair (Luc) of Westport, Jocelyne Bolduc-Morin (Jules) of Timmins and Chantal Davis (Wayne) of Ottawa. Loving grandmother of her precious grandchildren Denis, Martin (Jaymie), Natasha (Eric), Janelle (TJ), Justin, Amanda (Khaled), Kevin (Julia) and Kayla (Nathan), as well as her great-grandchildren. Survived by her dear brothers Laurent (Yvonne) Lévesque, Pierre (Martine) Lévesque and André (Fe) Lévesque, as well as her sisters-in-law Réjeanne Lévesque, Denise Marin-Lévesque, Nicole (Pierre) Bolduc and Rita Bolduc. Predeceased by her parents Lydia and Jean-Baptiste Lévesque, her parents-in-law Léandre and Irène Bolduc, as well as her brothers, sisters, brothers-in-law and sisters-in-law Alice Blais (Louis), Robert Lévesque (Rose), Gertrude Grenon (Fernando), Sœur Marie-Marthe Lévesque, Paul Lévesque (Rhéa), Sœur Lucille Lévesque, Marc Lévesque, Sœur Laurette Lévesque, Amédée Lévesque (Claudette), Roger Lévesque (Huguette), Raymond Lévesque, Laurian Bolduc and Aurèle Bolduc. As a school teacher, Claire always had the well-being of her students at heart. She will always be remembered as a kind and generous individual who took great joy in helping others. She thoroughly enjoyed spending time with her family, camping and travelling. A special thank you to the staff at Extendicare for their excellent care. A funeral service will be held on Saturday October 21, 2023 at 1 p.m. at St-Dominique Church. Interment at the Timmins Memorial Cemetery will follow. The family will receive friends and family members on Saturday from 12 p.m. (noon) to 1pm at St-Dominique Church. Funeral arrangements have been entrusted with LESSARD-STEPHENS Funeral Home. Remembrance donations made to the Alzheimer Society of Canada or the Timmins and District Hospital Foundation would be greatly appreciated. Online condolences and donations can be made at
